clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of a Dermatology-Specific Treatment Satisfaction Instrument
clinical_study.official_title: Validation of a Dermatology-Specific Treatment Satisfaction Instrument

collaborator.agency: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to validate a dermatology-specific questionnaire that assesses patient satisfaction with their treatments across various inflammatory dermatology diseases.

primary_outcome.measure: Validity and reliability of a dermatology-specific treatment satisfaction instrument in patients with psoriasis
primary_outcome.description: For this survey study, the investigators will gather descriptive statistics for each item in the questionnaire. The investigators will also measure the following psychometric properties: measurement error, reliability and construct validity, as measured by convergent and known-groups validity

intervention.description: Study subjects will also be administered a dermatology-specific treatment satisfaction questionnaire, as well as other questionnaires including the generic validated Treatment Satisfaction Questionnaire for Medication (TSQM-9) and the validated Dermatology Life Quality Index (DLQI). Study participants will also self-report their disease severity using PGA. Depending on patients' preferred method of interacting with the study team, the investigators will collect their responses to these questionnaires either in-person, over the phone, or electronically via secure research platforms.

study_pop.textblock: Adult (≥ 18 years) dermatology patients with psoriasis from LAC+USC and Keck Medical Centers, the Brigham and Women's Hospital, and the Mount Sinai Hospital.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult (≥ 18 years)
- Psoriasis patients undergoing some form of treatment
